p: Young people face tremendous challenges to access HIV and sexual and reproductive health services, including inequalities, discrimination, exclusion, and violence. More efforts are needed to ensure that young people are not left behind. The current drafting of the National Harm Reduction Plan is an opportune time for Mozambique to consider comprehensive and integrated harm reduction programs and policies that focus on youth PWID to reduce the high-risk sexual and drug use behaviors that contribute to the growing HIV epidemic in the country. Effective interventions in this young generation may protect the public health investments for adults in the future.
